trans-unit.source: Provides a container for Windows toolbar objects.
ToolStrip is the base class for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusStrip>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip>.

Use ToolStrip and its associated classes in new Windows Forms applications to create toolbars that can have a Windows XP, Office, Internet Explorer, or custom appearance and behavior, all with or without themes, and with support for overflow and run-time item reordering.

ToolStrip controls also offer a rich design-time experience that includes in-place activation and editing, custom layout, and sharing of horizontal or vertical space within a specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer>.
The ToolStrip class provides many members that manage painting, mouse and keyboard input, and drag-and-drop functionality.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer> class with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripManager> class to gain even more control and customizability over the painting and layout style of all ToolStrip controls on a Windows Form.

The following items are specifically designed to work seamlessly with both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSystemRenderer> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripProfessionalRenderer> in all orientations.

They are available by default at design time for the ToolStrip control: - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSeparator> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLabel> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextBox> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripComboBox> You can join ToolStrip controls within a specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer> and merge ToolStrip controls with each other.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> rather than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer> for Multiple Document Interface (MDI) applications.
Typically, a ToolStrip does not participate in the tab order unless it is absolutely positioned rather than being docked or in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripControlHost> class to host any other Windows Forms control in a ToolStrip.
By default, the ToolStrip is double buffered, taking advantage of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles> setting.

Although ToolStrip replaces and adds functionality to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> control of previous versions, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> class with the specified array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>s.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether drag-and-drop and item reordering are handled through events that you implement.

Set the AllowDrop property to `true` and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowItemReorder%2A> property to `false` to respond to drag-and-drop behavior you have defined in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragEnter?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragLeave?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragDrop?displayProperty=fullName> events.

Set AllowDrop to `false` and set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowItemReorder%2A> to `true` to cause the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> class to handle drag-and-drop and item reordering automatically.

Set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowItemReorder%2A> to `true` for two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> objects to allow dragging of items from one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> to the other.
To enable the default drag-and-drop, the ALT key must be pressed during the drag operation.
Setting both AllowDrop and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowItemReorder%2A> to `true` throws an exception.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to control drag-and-drop and item reordering through events that you implement; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
AllowDrop and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowItemReorder*> are both set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether drag-and-drop and item reordering are handled privately by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> class.

Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowDrop%2A> property to `true` and set the AllowItemReorder property to `false` to respond to drag-and-drop behavior you have defined in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragEnter?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragLeave?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DragDrop?displayProperty=fullName> events.

Set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowDrop%2A> to `false` and set AllowItemReorder to `true` to cause the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> class to handle drag-and-drop and item reordering automatically.
Set AllowItemReorder to `true` for two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> objects to allow dragging of items from one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> to the other.
To enable the default drag-and-drop, the ALT key must be pressed during the drag operation.
Setting both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowDrop%2A> and AllowItemReorder to `true` throws an exception.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to cause the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> class to handle drag-and-drop and item reordering automatically; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AllowDrop*> and AllowItemReorder are both set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether multiple <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>, and other types can be combined.
Use the AllowMerge property to enable multiple-document interface (MDI) children to combine their respective menus in the MDI parent.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if combining of types is allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets the edges of the container to which a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is bound and determines how a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is resized with its parent.
Use the Anchor property to define how a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> is automatically resized as its parent control is resized.
Anchoring a control to its parent control ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent control when the parent control is resized.
> [!NOTE] > The Anchor and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Dock%2A> properties are mutually exclusive.
Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AnchorStyles"></xref> values.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to automatically scroll; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Automatic scrolling is not supported by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> controls.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> value.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> value.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is automatically resized to display its entire contents.

If you set AutoSize to `false` and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> is embedded in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer> panel, the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> are not translated when you move the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> to a different panel of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer>.

To translate the bounds properly, synchronize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.LayoutStyleChanged> event, check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Orientation%2A> property, and resize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Image%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageAlign%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageKey%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> properties pertain to various aspects of image handling.
Use images in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> controls by setting these properties directly or by setting the run-timeâ€“only <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ImageList%2A> property.

Image scaling is determined by the interaction of properties in both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>, as follows: - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ImageScalingSize%2A> is the scale of the final image as determined by the combination of the image's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> setting and the container's AutoSize setting.

- If AutoSize is `true` (the default) and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, no image scaling occurs, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> size is that of the largest item, or a prescribed minimum size.

- If AutoSize is `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, neither image nor <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> scaling occurs.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control adjusts its width to closely fit its contents; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize*> property has changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the background color for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
The BackColor property does not support transparent colors unless the `SupportsTransparentBackColor` value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles?displayProperty=fullName> is set to `true`.
The BackColor property is an ambient property.
An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> will have the same BackColor as its parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> by default.
For more information about ambient properties, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AmbientProperties> class or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class overview.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
The default is the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor*> property.
Occurs when the user begins to drag the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the binding context for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> returns a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> for all data-bound controls contained by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> keeps all controls that are bound to the same data source synchronized.

For example, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.Position%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> specifies the item in the underlying list that all data-bound controls point to.

For more information about creating a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext> and assigning it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BindingContext%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> can be sent to an overflow menu.
Set the CanOverflow property to `true` to send a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> item to an overflow menu when the item's content exceeds the width of the toolbar.
> [!NOTE] > If there are more overflow items than can be displayed on the form, use the ToolStrip Items Collection Editor to manage this situation.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to send <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> items to an overflow menu; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> causes validation to be performed on any controls that require validation when it receives focus.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.CausesValidation*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
To be added.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
To be added.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> representing the collection of controls contained within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> item.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> item.
Creates a new instance of the control collection for the control.
A new instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> assigned to the control.
Creates a default <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> with the specified text, image, and event handler on a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> instance.
The text to use for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>.
If the `text` parameter is a hyphen (-), this method creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSeparator"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>.
An event handler that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is clicked.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Drawing.Image%2CSystem.EventHandler%29?displayProperty=fullName>, or a if the text parameter is a hyphen (-).
Specifies the visual arrangement for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
The visual arrangement to be applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use the Cursor property to get or set a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Cursor> used with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref> that represents the cursor to display when the mouse pointer is over the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets the docking location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>, indicating which borders are docked to the container.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref>.

Gets or sets a value representing the default direction in which a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control is displayed relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use the DefaultDropDownDirection property to get or set where a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> control appears in relation to its container.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
Gets the default spacing, in pixels, between the sizing grip and the edges of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> values representing the spacing, in pixels.
Gets the spacing, in pixels, between the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref>.
Gets the internal spacing, in pixels, of the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

By default, the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> are padded one pixel from the right edge of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> to prevent the right border from painting over a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> that is right-aligned.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> value of `(0, 0, 1, 0)`.
Gets a value indicating whether ToolTips are shown for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> by default.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets the default size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
The DefaultSize property represents the <xref:System.Drawing.Size> value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> when it is initially created.
You can adjust the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> by setting its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreferredSize%2A> property value.
> [!NOTE] > To maintain better performance, do not set the <xref:System.Drawing.Size> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> in its constructor.
Instead, override the DefaultSize property.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

Gets the subset of items that are currently displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>, including items that are automatically added into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use the DisplayedItems property to access only those items that are currently displayed.
These are the items that are not currently in an overflow menu.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Items%2A> collection to retrieve all the items of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection"></xref> representing the items that are currently displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Retrieves the current display rectangle.
The display rectangle is the area where you lay out items.
The position and dimensions of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> display rectangle change during automatic scrolling.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> area for item layout.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.

Gets or sets which <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is resized with its parent.
Use the Dock property to define how a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> is automatically resized as its parent control is resized.

For example, setting Dock to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle> causes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized.
Controls are docked in their z-order, which is the visual layering of controls on a form along the form's z-axis (depth).
A control can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> control is in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> can be repositioned within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> and across <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel>s.

The Dock property is ignored, and if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Stretch%2A> property is `false`, the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> grows as items are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel>.
Typically, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> does not participate in the tab order.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Anchor%2A> and Dock properties are mutually exclusive.
Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref>.
Occurs when the user stops dragging the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the font used to display text in the control.
The current default font.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> representing the foreground color.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ForeColor*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
This method is not relevant for this class.
This method is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref>.
The child <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that is located at the specified coordinates.
This method is not relevant for this class.
This method is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GetChildAtPointSkip"></xref> value.
The child <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that is located at the specified coordinates.
Returns the item located at the specified point in the client area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> at which to search for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> at the specified location, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is not found.
Returns the item located at the specified x- and y-coordinates of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> client area.
The horizontal coordinate, in pixels, from the left edge of the client area.
The vertical coordinate, in pixels, from the top edge of the client area.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> located at the specified location, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is not found.
Retrieves the next <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> from the specified reference point and moving in the specified direction.
Use the GetNextItem method to get the next <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ArrowDirection> enumeration coordinates with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Orientation%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> that is the reference point from which to begin the retrieval of the next item.
One of the values of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ArrowDirection"></xref> that specifies the direction to move.
A that is specified by the start parameter and is next in the order as specified by the direction parameter.
The specified value of the direction parameter is not one of the values of .
Gets the orientation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> move handle.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripDisplayStyle"></xref> values.
Possible values are <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripDisplayStyle"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripDisplayStyle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the space around the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> move handle.
Use the GripMargin property to get or set the space around the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> move handle.

Because <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding?displayProperty=fullName> can take individual values for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Top%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Bottom%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Left%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Right%2A>, you can adjust the space around the move handle as preferred.
The margin can even be off the edge of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref>, which represents the spacing.
Gets the boundaries of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> move handle.
Use the GripRectangle property to get boundaries for painting, hit testing, and so on.
An object of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, representing the move handle boundaries.
If the boundaries are not visible, the GripRectangle property returns <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Gets or sets whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> move handle is visible or hidden.

In a stack layout, make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> movable by putting it in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel> and ensuring that its GripStyle is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref>.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref> values.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> has children; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HScrollProperties"></xref> class, which provides basic properties for an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HScrollBar"></xref>.
Gets or sets the image list that contains the image displayed on a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> item.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Image%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageAlign%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageKey%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> properties pertain to various aspects of image handling.
Use images in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> controls by setting these properties directly or by setting the run-timeâ€“only ImageList property.

Image scaling is determined by the interaction of properties in both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>, as follows: - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ImageScalingSize%2A> is the scale of the final image as determined by the combination of the image's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> setting and the container's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> setting.

- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> is `true` (the default) and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, no image scaling occurs, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> size is that of the largest item, or a prescribed minimum size.

- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> is `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, neither image nor <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> scaling occurs.
An object of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
Gets or sets the size, in pixels, of an image used on a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> property to control the default size of an image.

Use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> to make the size of the image on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> to automatically adjust to fit on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> while retaining the original image proportions.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Image%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageAlign%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageKey%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> properties pertain to various aspects of image handling.
Use images in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> controls by setting these properties directly or by setting the run-timeâ€“only <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ImageList%2A> property.

Image scaling is determined by the interaction of properties in both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>, as follows: - ImageScalingSize is the scale of the final image as determined by the combination of the image's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageScaling%2A> setting and the container's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> setting.

- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> is `true` (the default) and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, no image scaling occurs, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> size is that of the largest item, or a prescribed minimum size.

- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.AutoSize%2A> is `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemImageScaling>, neither image nor <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> scaling occurs.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> value representing the size of the image, in pixels.
The default is 16 x 16 pixels.
Gets a value indicating whether the user is currently moving the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> from one <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer"></xref> to another.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user is currently moving the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> from one <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer"></xref> to another; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether a character is an input character that the item recognizes.

The IsInputChar method is called during window message preprocessing to determine whether the given input character should be preprocessed or sent directly to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
If the IsInputChar method returns `true`, the specified character is sent directly to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
However, if the method returns `false`, the character is preprocessed and only sent to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> if it is not consumed by the preprocessing phase.
The preprocessing of a character includes checking whether the character is a mnemonic of another control.
The character to test.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the character should be sent directly to the item and not preprocessed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection"></xref>.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection"></xref>.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets all the items that belong to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use the Items collection to retrieve all the items that have been added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, not just the items that are displayed.
An item remains in the Items collection even if it is an overflow item and is therefore not currently visible.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.DisplayedItems%2A> property to retrieve only the items that are currently displayed on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>.
An object of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection"></xref>, representing all the elements contained by a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Occurs when the layout of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is complete.
When items do not fit within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, an overflow button automatically appears.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Overflow%2A> property setting determines whether an item appears in the overflow area always, as needed, or never.

Inspect the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Placement%2A> property in the LayoutCompleted event to determine whether an item was placed on the main <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, the overflow <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, or if it is not currently showing at all.

The typical reasons why an item is not displayed are that the item did not fit on the main <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> and its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Overflow%2A> property was set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemOverflow>.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Passes a reference to the cached <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LayoutEngine*> returned by the layout engine interface.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> that represents the cached layout engine returned by the layout engine interface.
Gets or sets layout scheme characteristics.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutSettings"></xref> representing the layout scheme characteristics.
Gets or sets a value indicating how the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> lays out the items collection.
The sizing grip will not be displayed unless you also set the LayoutStyle property to one of the overflow values.
If the LayoutStyle property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle>, the sizing grip will not be displayed.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> values.

The possible values are <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>.
The value of LayoutStyle is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.LayoutStyle*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.

This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> that is the overflow button for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> with overflow enabled.

An object of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflowButton"></xref> with its <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemAlignment"></xref> set to <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemAlignment"></xref> and its <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemOverflow"></xref> value set to <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemOverflow"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> move handle is painted.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Processes a command key.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref>, passed by reference, that represents the window message to process.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the character was processed by the control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Processes a dialog box key.
The ProcessDialogKey method is called during message preprocessing to handle dialog characters such as TAB, RETURN, ESCAPE, and arrow keys.
This method is called only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.IsInputKey%2A> method indicates that the control is not processing the key.
The ProcessDialogKey simply sends the character to the parent control's ProcessDialogKey method, or returns `false` if the control has no parent.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form?displayProperty=fullName> class overrides this method to perform actual processing of dialog box keys.
This method is only called when the control is hosted in a Windows Forms application or an ActiveX control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the key was processed by the control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Processes a mnemonic character.
The ProcessMnemonic method is called to give a control the opportunity to process a mnemonic character.
This method should determine whether the control is in a state to process mnemonics and whether the given character represents a mnemonic.
If so, the method should perform the action associated with the mnemonic and return `true`.
If not, the method should return `false`.

Implementations of this method often use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsMnemonic%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the given character matches a mnemonic in the control's text.
This default implementation of the ProcessMnemonic method simply returns `false`, to indicate that the control has no mnemonic.
The character to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the character was processed as a mnemonic by the control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref> used to customize the look and feel of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

Use the Renderer property and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer> class to customize the look and feel of any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> that does not have a window handle.
To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer>, assign it to the Renderer property, and call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Invalidate%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref> used to customize the look and feel of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Renderer*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates which visual styles will be applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
Use this property to indicate which set of visual styles the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> will use.
You can use this property to specify a professional rendering style, a default system rendering style, or a style managed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Renderer%2A> property value.
A value that indicates the visual style to apply.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderMode"></xref>.
The value being set is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderMode"></xref> values.

<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderMode"></xref> is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderMode"></xref> without the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Renderer*> property being assigned to a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref>.
This method is not relevant for this class.
This method is not relevant for this class.
Controls the return location of the focus.
Override the RestoreFocus method to control where the focus returns to when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.TabStop%2A> property is `false`.
Activates a child control.
Optionally specifies the direction in the tab order to select the control from.
The `directed` and `forward` parameters are used by container-style controls.
When the `directed` parameter is set to `true`, the `forward` parameter is evaluated to determine which control to select.
When `forward` is set to `true`, the next control in the tab order is selected; when `false`, the previous control in the tab order is selected.

The Select method activates the control if the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles?displayProperty=fullName> style bit is set to `true`, it is contained in another control, and all its parent controls are both visible and enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to specify the direction of the control to select; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to move forward in the tab order; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to move backward in the tab order.

Use the SetItemParent property when creating a custom layout engine.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> whose <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Parent*> property is to be changed.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> that is the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> referred to by the `item` parameter.

You would typically override this method to change the visibility behavior of the control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> is visible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether ToolTips are to be displayed on <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> items.
Use the ShowItemToolTips property to determine whether ToolTips are displayed for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if ToolTips are to be displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> stretches from end to end in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer"></xref>.
Use the Stretch property to get or set whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> automatically fills its container.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> stretches from end to end in its <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripContainer"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> using the TAB key.
When the user presses the TAB key, the input focus is set to the next <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> in the tab order.
Controls with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabStop%2A> property value of `false` are not included in the collection of controls in the tab order.
You can manipulate the tab order by changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabIndex%2A> property value for controls in the collection.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user can give the focus to an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> using the TAB key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the direction in which to draw text on a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.

Use the TextDirection property to get or set the direction of the display text of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLabel> or a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton>.

You can set the TextDirection property on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> itself, in which case the setting will apply to each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> you add to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip>, or you can set the TextDirection property differently for each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextDirection"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextDirection"></xref>.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextDirection"></xref> values.
Returns a string that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> control.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> control.

This property is not relevant for this class.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VScrollProperties"></xref> class, which provides basic properties for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VScrollBar"></xref>.
Processes Windows messages.
All messages are sent to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc%2A> method after getting filtered through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreProcessMessage%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc%2A> method corresponds exactly to the Windows `WindowProc` function.

For more information about processing Windows messages, see the `WindowProc` function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
